notableFeats: Successfully deserted the Fire Nation Navy
Faced Admiral Zhao and his forces, escaping unharmed
Created massive, controlled walls of fire to aid the White Lotus in liberating Ba Sing Se

allegianceHistory.reasonForLeaving: Disillusionment with the war and destruction.

finalAppearance: Graphic Novel: The Promise Part Three

narrativeArcs.summary: Coming to terms with the destructive nature of his element and finding a new purpose in peace.

eraAppearances.focus: Serving as Aang's first, reluctant firebending teacher and demonstrating an alternative firebending philosophy.
Joining the Order of the White Lotus to help liberate Ba Sing Se.

relationships: Order of the White Lotus (Fellow Members)
internalConflicts: his identity as a firebender vs. his hatred for fire's destruction
emotionalWounds: the actions of his former students
worldview: Believes firebending is a dangerous curse that must be rigorously controlled to avoid causing pain and destruction.
iconicQuotes: Fire brings only destruction and pain.
To master the bending disciplines, you must first master discipline itself.
I had a student once who had no discipline. I told him that firebending was not a toy. He had the spirit of a dragon, and he misused it.
linguisticQuirks: Speaks in a weary, solemn tone
name: Jeong Jeong
description: Once a celebrated admiral in the Fire Nation Navy, Jeong Jeong became horrified by the destruction wrought by his element and his students. He deserted his post, forever branded as "The Deserter". Living as a nomad in the Earth Kingdom, he adopted a philosophy of discipline and restraint, viewing firebending as a dangerous curse. His wisdom and immense power make him a formidable, if reluctant, master and a key member of the Order of the White Lotus.
highlights: The first person known to have deserted the Fire Nation military and survived.
Reluctantly agreed to teach Avatar Aang after being visited by the spirit of Avatar Roku.
Emphasized discipline and control as the core of firebending, not rage.
As a member of the White Lotus, helped liberate Ba Sing Se from Fire Nation control.
quotes: Fire brings only destruction and pain.
You have not yet mastered water, or earth. You are not ready for fire!
Destiny? What would a boy know of destiny?
role: A wise but embittered mentor who introduces Aang to the dangers and responsibilities of firebending, representing an alternative to the Fire Nation's philosophy of destruction.
